author: wsjcom
title: In Defense of Keeping the CAFE Standards
text: For years the Environmental Protection Agency has been easing vehicle-emissions standards for large trucks and SUVs, in part by allowing higher emissions from trucks and SUVs, but also by implementing a “footprint” model that allows larger vehicles to emit more pollution than smaller vehicles (“EPA Easing Vehicle-Emissions Standards,” U.S. News, April 3). So whether or not the last round of Obama-era vehicle-emissions standards were too strict, the fact that consumers are purchasing more trucks and SUVs in no way affects car manufacturers’ ability to meet those standards. Accounting for changes in consumer preferences...
